intro: Stauntonia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stauntonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Stauntonia angustifolia prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
